titleInfo.title: Pie eating contest at Elizabeth Park, Nashville, Tennessee, circa 1960s

mods.identifier: RG 3 3745 Parks Elizabeth pie eating contest ca 1960s 005

location.physicalLocation: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library

mods.abstract: Pictured: African American children enjoying a pie eating contest at Elizabeth Park in Nashville, Tennessee, circa 1960s. Elizabeth Park is located at 1701 Arthur Avenue, between cross streets Jane Street and 11th Avenue N. Affiliated with Metro Board of Parks and Recreation, Elizabeth Park is located near Bicentennial Mall in North Nashville. Forms part of Record Group 3, Metro Davidson County Photographer. 1 photograph negative : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
mods.accessCondition: U.S. and international copyright laws protect this digital content, which is provided for educational purposes only and may not be downloaded, reproduced, or distributed for any other purpose without written permission. Please contact the Metro Archives, Nashville Public Library, 615 Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 37219. Telephone (615) 862-5880.
